intro: Hieracium maculosiforme, commonly known as the spotted hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium maculosiforme is known for its ability to spread rapidly through rhizomes, making it an invasive species in some regions.
